StoredProcedureSqlServerv2k5.name: [DeleteCandidateProfessedExamFromPac]
StoredProcedureSqlServerv2k5.body:
@NWAId uniqueiden..er, @ProfessedExamType char(1), @ExamDate date.me, @ExamEnteredDate date.me
AS BEGIN
-- STEP 1: Start the transac.on BEGIN TRANSACTION
DECLARE @PersonID int; DECLARE @ExamID uniqueiden..er;
SELECT @PersonID = MARINE_CANDIDATE_ID FROM dbo.NWA WHERE rowguid = @NWAId
SELECT TOP 1 @ExamID = rowguid FROM dbo.CANDIDATE_PROFESSED_EXAM WHERE MARINE_CANDIDATE_ID = @PersonID AND [PROFESSED_EXAM_TYPE] = @ProfessedExamType AND [EXAM_DATE] = @ExamDate AND YEAR([EXAM_ENTERED_DATE]) = YEAR(@ExamEnteredDate) AND MONTH([EXAM_ENTERED_DATE]) = MONTH(@ExamEnteredDate) AND DAY([EXAM_ENTERED_DATE]) = DAY(@ExamEnteredDate) AND DATEPART(hour,[EXAM_ENTERED_DATE]) = DATEPART(hour, @ExamEnteredDate) AND DATEPART(minute,[EXAM_ENTERED_DATE]) = DATEPART(minute, @ExamEnteredDate) AND DATEPART(second,[EXAM_ENTERED_DATE]) = DATEPART(second, @ExamEnteredDate)
-- STEP 2 & 3: Issue the data change statement(s), checking @@ERROR a.er each statement IF @ExamID IS NOT NULL BEGIN DELETE FROM dbo.CANDIDATE_PROFESSED_EXAM WHERE rowguid = @ExamID
END
-- Rollback the transac.on if there were any errors IF @@ERROR <> 0 BEGIN -- Rollback the transac.on ROLLBACK TRANSACTION
-- Raise an error and return RAISERROR ('Error occurred while performing the change.', 16, 1) RETURN END
-- Rollback the transac.on if the number of rows changed does not meet our expecta.on... IF @@ROWCOUNT > 1 BEGIN -- Rollback the transac.on ROLLBACK TRANSACTION
-- Raise an error and return RAISERROR ('An unexpected number of rows were changed.', 16, 1) RETURN END
-- STEP 4: If we reach this point, the commands completed successfully -- Commit the transac.on.... COMMIT TRANSACTION
END
